supervisor_account

Who

Students and PhDs from many countries and of all ages, coming to Pisa and Florence to discover the Lights of Tuscany.

today

When

From the 15th to the 19th of May 2026, arrival and departures included.

location_on

Where

Three days in Florence, two in Pisa. Check out the Schedule section to see all the places, laboratories and universities you will have the opportunity to visit.

  • INFN - LABEC

    Laboratory of Nuclear Techniques for the Environment and Cultural Heritage, part of INFN in Florence

  • UNESCO IDL

    We are supported by UNESCO International Day of Light!

  • VIRGO conference

    Conferences about the VIRGO interferometer hosted by the European Gravitational Observatory (EGO)

  • VIRGO

    Pictures from previous editions

  • Pisa

    Pictures from previous editions

  • INFN

    The National Institute of Nuclear Physics

  • UNIPI

    The labs of the University of Pisa

  • UNIFI

    The labs of the University of Florence

send

The event is open to all students of the International Association of Physics Students (IAPS). It will bring students and phds to visit some of the most advanced research facilities in Tuscany, with a focus on Photonics and Optics and one key mission: to foster enthusiasm in the minds of young physicists.

AISF Local committees of Pisa and Florence are waiting for you at the seventh edition of Lights of Tuscany!

Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica

The Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica (AISF) is a non-profit organization with educational purposes that gathers together all the Italian students of physics. It was founded in Heidelberg in August 2014 and since January 2015 is a National Committee of the International Association of Physics Students (IAPS). AISF counts more than 1000 members and 16 Local Committees.
